title: Topic 005 Question 015
body: A company migrates existing Ubuntu Linux servers from their on-premises vSphere infrastructure to Azure.
The virtual machines (VMs) are experiencing a low network throughput of 20 Mbps. The VMs are expected to sustain 300 Mbps.
You need to ensure that the VMs are compatible with Azure.
options: Configure the network interfaces to 1000 Mbps/full duplex.
Increase the TCP buffers and window size kernel parameters.
Redeploy the VM with Accelerated Networking enabled.
Install a kernel name that ends with -azure.
